Package itunesq

Class Logging

java.lang.Object
itunesq.Logging
public class Logging extends Object
Class that provides some assistance for using logback/SLF4J for logging. This is a singleton class.
Author:
Jon

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class

    static class 
    Logging.Dimension
    The dimension, or scope, of a logger.

    • setDefaultLogLevel

      public void setDefaultLogLevel​(ch.qos.logback.classic.Level level)
      Sets the default log level. This is called once early in initialization.
      Parameters:
      level - default log level

    • createDiagLogger

      public void createDiagLogger()
      Creates the diagnostic logger. This logger is used for diagnostic information that must always be logged, regardless of any user defined logging levels.

    • registerLogger

      public void registerLogger​(Logging.Dimension dimension, ch.qos.logback.classic.Logger logger)
      Registers a logger.

      Loggers are obtained on a per-class basis. A class can contain several loggers, each representing a different dimension. The registry is a map of dimension to a list of loggers using that dimension.

      Parameters:
      dimension - dimension for this logger
      logger - logger to be registered

    • saveDirectoryUpdated

      public static void saveDirectoryUpdated​(String oldDirectory, String newDirectory)
      Moves all log files when the save directory has been changed.
      Parameters:
      oldDirectory - directory where log files are currently located
      newDirectory - new save directory

    • getLogLevelValues

      public org.apache.pivot.collections.Sequence<String> getLogLevelValues()
      Gets the list of log level values.
      Returns:
      list of log level values

    • updateLogLevelsFromPrefs

      public void updateLogLevelsFromPrefs()
      Sets the log levels for all dimensions from the preferences.

    • updateMaxHistoryFromPref

      public void updateMaxHistoryFromPref()
      Sets the maximum log history from the preference.
